Posts.Content: Aw JollyG you will definitely find out after surgery results what they suggest as treatment, if it is needed at all! It may be that they are able to get a wide enough margin which means treatment might not be necessary. I only had RT because although they had clear margins it was too close to the chest wall to be sure. I was lucky enough that RT wasn’t too bad for me though the skin did break a little in the last week. For now just concentrate on getting through the surgery and if you decide not to have reconstruction then that’s fine too. I do hope you get a date soon as I can sympathise with the worry and frustration as I had to wait 7 weeks and felt it was getting bigger (probably not). Keep strong and love yourself x

Posts.Title: Phyllodes/sarcoma

Posts.Content: Oh JollyG it’s always complicated isn’t it! I found a lump in September last year and although referred was assured it was nothing to worry about even following ultrasound and biopsy which showed PT, as it’s rarely malignant! I had excision biopsy done which confirmed malignancy and then a WLE to clear everything, I was told it had all gone and went on a much needed holiday. Two months later another lump only bigger and told it would be fine until radiologist started sticking many needles into me and frowning. It was confirmed that it was PT and now aggressive so had to have mastectomy (which I had asked for initially). My lymph nodes were clear so Radiotherapy was the treatment required as this doesn’t usually need chemo. I didn’t get to choose reconstruction at the time due to RT and will decide later about this, more waiting lists! I am now used to nothing on one side and am seriously wondering about reducing the other breast instead  (I’m quite large) as I don’t want an implant and the other surgery means at least two more! You go with your gut as it usually gets it right! Best of luck and stick to your guns. Let me know how it goes x

Posts.Content: Hi scruffi, hope you don’t mind me joining your chat as we seem to have similar stories. Have your previous surgeries shown PT as malignant or benign - I’m assuming benign as they would have suggested mastectomy before now. I had two surgeries at turn of year which was for malignant PT and they thought they had it clear but 2 months later it was back bigger than ever and a mastectomy was needed. It was against my chest wall but they are happy they got it all and I then had 6 weeks of Radiotherapy to confirm clearance. It seems that this PT is a creeping form of cancer that is not well enough known. I do hope you can discuss this with supporting medical and nursing staff who can help you with a clear treatment plan. Keep ranting, that’s what this site is good for. Be strong Cx

Posts.Content: Hi JollyG, sorry to hear you have had a provisional diagnosis of phyllodes. What is your next step to clarify your situation, have you had a biopsy and are they planning a wide excision?  Have you had previous fibroadenoma as this, from what I can read can be a pattern for this type of disease.
